config.change-clock-texture.name: Change Clock Texture
config.change-clock-texture.tooltip:
Replaces the texture of the clock in the vanilla game, so that the clock can intuitively display the distribution of daylight, darkness, and twilight shadows of the day.
If you prefer the vanilla texture, disable this option.
config.day-start-at-solar-height.name: Day Start At Solar Height (Unit: Degree)
config.day-start-at-solar-height.tooltip:
Set the minimum solar height angle of the day.
In general, it should be an opposite number to "Night Start At Solar Height".
config.ecliptic-obliquity.name: Ecliptic-Obliquity (Unit: Degree)
config.ecliptic-obliquity.tooltip: Set the obliquity of the ecliptic.
config.extend-early-day-daylight.name: Extend Early-Day Daylight
config.extend-early-day-daylight.tooltip: Until the first Spring Equinox (14 of Spring, Year 1), day and night will always be equal in length. Afterward, it reverts to the standard seasonal day-night cycle.
config.latitude.name: Latitude (Unit: Degree)
config.latitude.tooltip: Set the latitude of Stardew Valley.
config.night-darkness.name: Night Darkness
config.night-darkness.tooltip:
Set the darkness level of the night.
0.3 = Bright.
1.0 = Dark.
config.night-start-at-solar-height.name: Night Start At Solar Height (Unit: Degree)
config.night-start-at-solar-height.toolt:
Set the maximum solar height angle of the night.
In general, it should be an opposite number to "Day Start At Solar Height".
config.raining-darkness.name: Raining Darkness
config.raining-darkness.tooltip:
Set the darkness level during rain of the day.
0.0 = Bright.
0.3 = Dark.
